    • Method Detail

      • getTimePeriod

        public static fj.data.Validation<String,ChronoUnit> getTimePeriod(String human_readable_period)
        The simplest date parsing utility - only handles daily/hourly/monthly type strings (1d, d, daily, day - etc). Note "m" is ambiguous and not supported, use "min" or "month"
        Parameters:
        human_readable_period - - daily/hourly/monthly type strings (1d, d, daily, day - etc). Note "m" is ambiguous and not supported, use "min" or "month"
        Returns:
        a ChronoUnit if successful, else a generic error string

      • getTimeBasedSuffix

        public static String getTimeBasedSuffix(ChronoUnit grouping_period,
                                        Optional<ChronoUnit> lowest_granularity)
        Returns the suffix of a time-based index given the grouping period
        Parameters:
        grouping_period - - the grouping period
        lowest_granularity -
        Returns:
        the index suffix, ie added to the base index

        Returns:

      • getDateFromSuffix

        public static fj.data.Validation<String,Date> getDateFromSuffix(String suffix)
        Returns the date corresponding to a string in one of the formats returned by getTimeBasedSuffix
        Parameters:
        suffix - - the date string
        Returns:
        - either the date, or an error if the string is not correctly formatted

      • getDuration

        public static fj.data.Validation<String,Duration> getDuration(String human_readable_duration)
        Attempts to parse a (typically recurring) time
        Parameters:
        human_readable_duration - - Uses some simple regexes (1h,d, 1month etc), and Natty (try examples http://natty.joestelmach.com/try.jsp#)
        Returns:
        the machine readable duration, or an error

      • getDuration

        public static fj.data.Validation<String,Duration> getDuration(String human_readable_duration,
                                                              Optional<Date> base_date)
        Attempts to parse a (typically recurring) time
        Parameters:
        human_readable_duration - - Uses some simple regexes (1h,d, 1month etc), and Natty (try examples http://natty.joestelmach.com/try.jsp#)
        base_date - - for relative date, locks the date to this origin (mainly for testing in this case?)
        Returns:
        the machine readable duration, or an error

      • getSchedule

        public static fj.data.Validation<String,Date> getSchedule(String human_readable_date,
                                                          Optional<Date> base_date)
        Returns a date from a human readable date
        Parameters:
        human_readable_date - - the date expressed in words, eg "next wednesday".. Uses some simple regexes (1h,d, 1month etc), and Natty (try examples http://natty.joestelmach.com/try.jsp#)
        base_date - - for relative date, locks the date to this origin
        Returns:
        the machine readable date, or an error
